p: The substrates of P-gp are amphipatic cations and organic compounds whose molecular weights range from 200 to almost 1900 Da [ 24], so P-gp shows a broad substrate spectrum. MRPs transport hydrophilic anion compounds or large molecules (MRP-1) [ 39] or small polar compounds (for example, nucleosides), cyclic nucleotides, and nucleoside analogues (MRP-4, MRP-5) [ 40]. The substrate specificity of BCRP appears similar to that of P-gp [ 27].
